title: Inaccurate Downloading Status Message
body:
I know this is literally semantics, but this small bug might confuse people without the wherewithal to figure out whats going on.
On trusty64 (probably others), importing a base box from the local file system presents a status message that makes it appear as though Vagrant is downloading a box when it is really decompressing the tar.gz format of the desired local box.  Perhaps a more accurate message such as "Unpacking necessary files from:" would suffice for boxes beginning with file://.
### Steps to reproduce:

```
vagrant init file:///home/user/Software/VirtualMachines/VagrantBoxes/anyBox.box
vagrant up
```
### Output seen:

```
Bringing machine 'default' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
==> default: Box 'file:///home/user/Software/VirtualMachines/VagrantBoxes/anyBox.box' could not be found. Attempting to find and install...
    default: Box Provider: virtualbox
    default: Box Version: >= 0
==> default: Adding box 'file:///home/user/Software/VirtualMachines/VagrantBoxes/anyBox.box' (v0) for provider: virtualbox
    **default: Downloading: file:///home/user/Software/VirtualMachines/VagrantBoxes/anyBox.box**
==> default: Successfully added box 'file:///home/user/Software/VirtualMachines/VagrantBoxes/anyBox.box' (v0) for 'virtualbox'!
==> default: Importing base box 'file:///home/user/Software/VirtualMachines/VagrantBoxes/anyBox.box'...
```

If one runs iotop its clear that the process "bsdtar -v -x" is doing a ton of read / writes to disk.
Nethogs also shows zero packets being transferred.

This message is almost certainly an artifact of a previously download-only implementation--and I'm sure most of us can gather that immediately.  For others, not needing to worry that their system is importing the wrong box might be of use! 

Thanks for the great project!
